RECORD.TEXT: 7111426 47933/f911 557344 11/19/1994 12:00:00 AM ADMISSION DATE : 11/19/94 Mr. Blind is a 79-year-old white white male with a history of diabetes mellitus , inferior myocardial infarction , who underwent open repair of his increased diverticulum November 13th at Sephsandpot Center . The patient developed hematemesis November 15th and was intubated for respiratory distress . The patient attempted a gastrografin swallow on the 21st , but was unable to cooperate with probable aspiration . The patient also had been receiving generous intravenous hydration during the period for which he was NPO for his esophageal tear and intravenous Lasix for a question of pulmonary congestion . The patient was given intravenous Lasix . An electrocardiogram showed ST depressions in V2 through V4 which improved with sublingual and intravenous nitroglycerin . The patient was transferred to the Coronary Care Unit for management of his congestive heart failure , ischemia and probable aspiration pneumonia . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : 1. coronary artery disease . 4. history of cholecystectomy . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : The patient 's medications at home were Micronase , Isordil and aspirin . 8. SOCIAL HISTORY : The patient 's social history is remarkable for greater than 80 pack years of smoking , which he discontinued 15 years prior to admission . He is a former alcoholic , but without any alcohol in 30 years prior to admission . He is legally blind . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : On physical examination he is a tachypneic white male on 40 percent face mask with oxygen saturations 98 percent . He was afebrile . His oropharynx was clear . He had no gag . He had a scar that was healing in the left neck . His heart rate was regular rate and rhythm . His abdomen was benign . He was oriented times two . He moved extremities times four . His reflexes were 2+ and symmetric . His toes were down going . LABORATORY DATA : Four liter arterial blood gas of 71/43/7.45 , ionized calcium 1.03 , normal electrolytes , BUN and creatinine 16/1.4 , glucose 246 , calc , mag and phos normal , albumin 2.2 , LDH 227 , liver function tests normal , white count 10.6 , hematocrit 32 which was 31 on the 19th and 38 on the 16th , prothrombin time 9.9 , partial thromboplastin time 26 . Cultures of the blood , urine and sputum were pending at that time . A sputum gram stain showed moderate polys with few gram negative rods . An electrocardiogram on admission to the CCU showed normal sinus , 90 beats per minute , with a normal axis , normal intervals , an old inferior myocardial infarction and up sloping ST depressions with V2 to V4 with increased rate . These improved with decreased rate . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted to the Coronary Care Unit and placed on Unasyn for a question of aspiration pneumonia . He was also placed on intravenous nitroglycerin , oxygen and aspirin for his coronary ischemia . The patient remained stable in the Coronary Care Unit and was transferred to the floor on the 23rd on aspirin , Carafate , intravenous Haldol , nebs , Unasyn , NPH with CZI sliding coverage , morphine , Compazine and intravenous Benadryl . His hematocrit was 28 at the time of transfer . He was still guaiac positive at that time . His mental status was improved from admission to the CCU . However , on the 24th he had a massive upper GI bleed . There was large fresh clot covering the lower part of the esophagus starting at 35 cm and extending distally to the esophagogastric junction along the left curvature side of the stomach . The clot was dense despite multiple attempts at lavage . The pylorus was entered and the first and second portion of the duodenum were inspected and were seen to be normal . He was readmitted to the Coronary Care Unit on the 25th , where initially he was stable . His aspirin was discontinued . He was transfused to keep hematocrit greater than 30 . He was seen in consultation by the OLH Service , who felt he was a candidate for total parenteral nutrition . On the 25th he developed progressive hypotension with evidence of further upper gastrointestinal bleeding . Repeat endoscopy was unsuccessful because of severe bleeding despite massive lavage . A pneumothorax was noted on his chest X-ray on the 25th and a chest tube was placed . No varices were noted . The patient returned to the floor on the 26th with improved hemodynamics . Given the multi organ system failure on the 26th the family was consulted regarding his dismal prognosis and they decided to make the patient do not resuscitate without further pressures or aggressive measures with comfort care being paramount . The patient continued to have bleeding with progressive downward deterioration of his mental status and renal failure and temperature spikes . The patient died on the 31st .
